comments:
When I try to profile StartStop on a Lenovo T60p (CoreDuo 2.18Mhz - 2007-83U) using TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100C build and Sun 1.5 JRE (build 1.5.0_06-b05) I get: 

-in the Eclipse Console view:

[Error: FATAL ERROR: JPIAgent can't load ACCollector]

-in the Eclipse OSGi console (started with -console):

Exception in thread "slavescu1_connection" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "4294967295"

org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.TimeoutException: Launching Process command timed out.
Slava - pls look into this defect.
Marius - Can you attach the test case for this defect.

Marius,
  I have not been able to recreate this issue. Its very possible you are using a EM64T/X86_64 based machine and the IAC paths are not right. This has to be addressed by the project and we should have this discussion in the AG call.

Guru, I mentioned in my first comment that this happens on a T60p - CoreDuo machine -  which is 32 bit.

How can I debug this problem?  is there any debug flag that I can enable and give you more details?

Currently I cannot use the JVMTI profiler from TPTP 4.4 on my machine.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Marius - Can you attach the test case for this defect.
> 

Start the workbench, create a launch configuration to profile Eclipse, select Execution Time Analysis and press Profile.
Try with both IAC and AC.
WOrks for me with yesterdays driver. Seems like a configuration issue to me.
